reviews.review: Not that good. Songs are about as awkward as a date with Elsa...

Boring, boring, boring. At least the first one had some unexpected twists. Frozen II's plot could've been that of a phoned in TV special for middle schoolers. Much of the dialog consisted of overly sentimental tropes with some tacked on comic relief. The songs were good, but most of the time there was nothing important going on on-screen, instead just close up shots of a cartoon character belting out lyrics. Compare that with the storytelling and action in older Disney classics like Jungle Book, Aladdin, or Mary Poppins and it's just not even close. The musical sequences in those movies don't just tell you what's going on with the song lyrics, they convey through the choreography why the characters feel the way they do and take the actions they take, whereas you just have to take Elsa's word for it that she likes "going into the unknown" as she runs around in the snow for no particular reason.

I will say, the animation was spectacular. From the slight wrinkles and pills in the fabric of Anna's nightgown to the unbelievably realistic water animation, this movie is probably one of the greatest technical achievements ever in 3d animation. I just wish it had a more cohesive of a story and more fleshed out characters to draw in the adults in the audience.
Not nearly as good as the first. Songs aren't as good. No new major characters.
Didnt grab the attention of my kiddos like the first. They were up and moving around after 45 minutes and asked if they could leave before the movie was over. Not what I expected!

The animation in this movie is the most beautiful art to ever come out of Disney Animation Studios.  While the original was about Elsa learning to control her powers, the sequel is about Elsa finally learning to love herself, powers and all. Anna's momentous ballad of grief and loss is something that anyone will be able to able to relate to. Kudos to Disney for this incredible story about Bad B*tches.
As good if not better than the first!

Loved it! My 4 year old was on the edge of her seat and laughing out loud at all the funny parts! I didnt think i would love it as much as the first but I enjoyed it even more. The story is excellent and so moving and meaningful for a animated movie. Cant wait to see it again!
I like it better than the first and please can we forget let it go.
Amazing!  The first movie was so good that it was hard to imagine that this could compare. It did and then some.
I think we totally enjoyed this one even more then the first Frozen!
